intro: Scrophularia wilsonii, commonly known as Wilson's figwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows at high elevations.
